channel.title: How do i change the name of the server and
channel.description: hi how do i change the name of the server without using a jdk and how do i open a client.java?

item.title: How do i change the name of the server and
item.dc:creator: @darkrounge darkrounge
item.description:
@darkrounge wrote:

the easier way is to go to cilent.java and press ctrl and h
then type the server name in and under it type what you want the new name to be and press replace all!

Read full topic

item.title: How do i change the name of the server and
item.dc:creator: @atrox atrox_
item.description:
@atrox wrote:

[quote=“ziplock, post:5, topic:238446”][quote author=mr pker01 link=topic=314722.msg2502471#msg2502471 date=1224748482]
hi how do i change the name of the server without using a jdk and how do i open a client.java?
[/quote]

JDK is a folder in your program files. their are many different tools in that folder such as the one used to compile (javac). and thats all that jdk is.[/quote]
If your going to try and tell someone what something is, atleast tell it correctly.

JDK is Java Development Kit.

Read full topic

item.title: How do i change the name of the server and
item.dc:creator: @suomirunee suomirunee
item.description:
@suomirunee wrote:

You open client.java with notepad. And you need jdk for compiling, anything you add in client.java will not work if you don’t compile.

When you have jdk, search for your server base’s name and change it to what you want to your server name be. Repeat it until you have changed all base names to yours.

Read full topic
